# headingAccuracy

**Instance Property**

The maximum deviation (measured in degrees) between the reported heading and the true geomagnetic heading.

## Declaration

```swift
var headingAccuracy: CLLocationDirection { get }
```

## Discussion

A positive value in this property represents the potential error between the value reported by the [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLHeading/magneticHeading] property and the actual direction of magnetic north. Thus, the lower the value of this property, the more accurate the heading. A negative value means that the reported heading is invalid, which can occur when the device is uncalibrated or there is strong interference from local magnetic fields.

## Getting the heading values

- **magneticHeading**: The heading (measured in degrees) relative to magnetic north.
- **trueHeading**: The heading (measured in degrees) relative to true north.
